intro: Cybelion teres, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Cybelion teres is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils near human settlements.
